title: The Thing: Remastered Release Date Possibly Leaked
excerpt: The Thing: Remastered's release date appears online before an official announcement from the publisher can be made.
author: Dalton Cooper
body:
KEY TAKEAWAYS
The release date for The Thing: Remastered is reportedly set for December 5, according to Xbox.
The remastered version promises enhanced graphics and performance improvements.
Nightdive Studios, known for quality remasters, is handling The Thing: Remastered.
It looks as though The Thing: Remastered will be launching on Thursday, December 5. The Thing: Remastered is the remastered version of the 2002 video game based on John Carpenter's classic sci-fi horror movie The Thing. The Thing was a hit back when it released in 2002, with many praising it as one of the better survival-horror games of the era.
Considering the commercial success of The Thing video game, it's no surprise that there was some demand for it to be remastered for modern platforms. Nightdive Studios has stepped up to remaster The Thing, promising to deliver the game before the end of the year. With 2024 nearly at an end, no specific release date has been announced. However, it seems as though the cat has been let out of the bag.
RELATED
The Thing (1982) Ending, Explained
The end of 1982's The Thing has confused fans for decades at this point, so what exactly happens?
Xbox recently published a post highlighting upcoming games for its platforms. As spotted by Pure Xbox, the post includes a December 5 release date for The Thing: Remastered, along with confirmation that the game is optimized for Xbox Series X/S consoles and supports Smart Delivery. It's quite possible that this release date is inaccurate, but there's also a chance that it is indeed the release date for The Thing: Remastered. With December 5 right around the corner, fans won't have to wait long to find out, in any case.
The Thing: Remastered Rumored Release Date
Thursday, December 5
For those unfamiliar with the game, The Thing video game serves as a sequel to the movie. Players are tasked with exploring the outpost from the movie to figure out what happened to the research team that was stationed there, only to find themselves having to fight off the titular "thing." Blending survival-horror and third-person shooter elements, The Thing was mostly well-received at the time of its release in 2002.
The Thing: Remastered is bringing various enhancements to the table that should help the game reach a modern audience. The big thing is that The Thing: Remastered will feature better graphics than the original, but it will also enjoy improved performance and will be addressing some complaints fans had about the original. Notably, the wonky Infection system from the original game is being addressed by The Thing: Remastered, which should go a long way in improving the overall experience.
Fans of The Thing can rest assured that the remaster is in good hands. Nightdive Studios has built a reputation for delivering high-quality remasters of old-school games, and there's no reason to assume that the same won't hold true for The Thing: Remastered, whether it release on December 5 or a different date entirely.
Your Rating
Rate Now
10/10
The Thing
The Thing takes place shortly after Carpenter's 1982 film and plays off of many of the same themes of mood, distrust, fear, and monstrous baddies. It plays out as FPS as you try to determine what has happened and who in your team has become infected.

  Survival Horror

PC , PS2 , Xbox (Original)
Released
August 21, 2002

Computer Artworks
Publisher(s)
VU Games , Konami

game engine

title: Ubisoft Insider Claims the Company Wants Steam to Hide Concurrent Player Data
excerpt: According to a Ubisoft insider, the company, along with many others, wants Steam to hide concurrent player data.
author: Brett Byll
question:
Ubisoft Insider Claims the Company Wants Steam to Hide Concurrent Player Data

According to a Ubisoft insider, the company, along with many others, wants Steam to hide concurrent player data.
answer: Ubisoft, along with other companies, allegedly wants Steam to conceal concurrent player data.

title: Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel Launches Limited-Time "Time Travel" Event
excerpt: Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel rolls out its newest limited-time "Time Travel" Duel Trial event, featuring a popular retro format based on an influential set.
author: Michael Brandon Ingram
body:
KEY TAKEAWAYS
Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel rolls out its new "Time Travel 2014" Duel Trial event, featuring a retro format based on the release of the "Duelist Alliance" set.
Players can use one of three Loaner Decks featuring popular archetypes like "HERO" and "Satellarknight" or build their own decks based on the format.
Winning three duels in the event rewards players with a free pack of Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel's newest Selection Pack, "Geas of the Light."
Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel has officially launched its newest "Time Travel" Duel Trial event, bringing players back to the release of one of the game's most influential sets. Konami has experimented with a wide variety of different events throughout the nearly three-year-long life of the digital version of its massively popular trading card game. Each month typically features one to two major Master Duel events, focusing around different deck-building restrictions, while smaller "Duel Trial" events utilize unique gimmicks for unusual dueling strategies. Now, Konami has rolled out its newest Duel Trial event.
While Duel Trials have taken many different forms since their introduction to Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel, "Time Travel" events have been a particularly popular variant of the mini-event. Konami first debuted the "Time Travel 2004" event in March, bringing players back to the early days of the game and the iconic "GOAT" format. Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel would follow up on the idea during the summer, with "Time Travel 2010" featuring a banlist and cardpool based on the popular "Edison" format. The newest Duel Trial format takes inspiration from a game-changing set in Yu-Gi-Oh's history.
RELATED
Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel Announces New Limited-Time Event
Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel reveals the newest limited-time event coming to the game, featuring a return to one of the game's beloved retro formats.
Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel debuted its newest "Duel Trial" event on Thursday night, introducing the "Time Travel 2014" mini-event. The event features a format based on the release of Yu-Gi-Oh's "Duelist Alliance" set, featuring the debut of iconic archetypes like "Shaddoll" and "Satellarknight," while utilizing the June 2014 banlist. The event provides players with three different Loaner decks based on themes like "HERO" and "Dragons," while also allowing players to use their own decks. Winning three duels during the event rewards players with a free pack of Master Duel's newest Selection Pack, "Geas of the Light."
Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel Launches "Time Travel 2014" Event
The format for Master Duel's "Time Travel 2014" marks one of the most notable turning points in the Yu-Gi-Oh TCG's history. The event's cardpool comes just following the debut of Pendulum Monsters, ushering in a new era of gameplay with more explosive combos and powerful new cards. "Shaddoll" also took over the game as one of Yu-Gi-Oh's most dominant decks, owed to boss Monsters like "El Shaddoll Winda" and "El Shaddoll Construct." Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel's "Time Travel 2014" event will run through the morning of December 3.
Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel's newest event is far from the only change arriving to the digital trading card game in the coming weeks. Konami recently unveiled the newest banlist update for Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel, banning powerful draw Spell "Pot of Prosperity" and limiting cards like "Fairy Tail - Snow" and "Dimension Shifter." December is also expected to welcome new Selection Packs to the game, introducing even more cards to the online TCG. Master Duel's new event looks to bring back one of the defining moments in Yu-Gi-Oh history for a limited time.
Your Rating
Rate Now
Leave a Review
Yu-Gi-Oh! Master Duel
Now you can play the "Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG" digitally, anywhere.
Fast-paced Duels with stunning HD graphics and a new, dynamic soundtrack! Get ready to challenge Duelists around the world!

The full Yu-Gi-Oh! experience is available for anyone at any Skill Level. Don't worry if you're a new player or if you haven't Dueled in a while, the in-game tutorials will teach you the basics on how to play the Yu-Gi-Oh! TRADING CARD GAME. You'll be given a Deck when you finish to help you start your journey!

Mix it up and put your Dueling skills to the test! A wide variety of events and tournaments will be available for players.

Build and Duel with different Decks utilizing 10,000+ unique cards and special rules unique to Tournaments!

Choose the tournament YOU want to Duel in and aim for that number one spot!

The Solo Mode guides you through storylines of the themes from the Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG. Hone your Dueling skills by completing the stories.

Recommended for beginners, returning players, and those of you who are interested in learning more about the lore of the world of the Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG.

title: Popular Xbox 360 RPG is Getting Remastered
excerpt: A recent announcement for an upcoming classicly styled RPG title shows off a wide range of visual upgrades and a variety of new features.
author: Zachary Cimaglio
body:
The highly-rated turn-based Xbox One RPG Breath of Death 7 is set to receive a remaster on December 12 exclusively on Steam, bringing a major visual overhaul, animation updates, and quality-of-life improvements. While the original Xbox One game came from indie studio Zeboyd Digital Entertainment, Breath of Death 7 Reanimated comes from Shadow Layer Games in its debut title.

excerpt: The Nintendo Switch will be the ultimate Donkey Kong Country console by the end of January.
author: Dalton Cooper
body:
Nintendo has recently highlighted the fact that the Switch will soon have access to every Donkey Kong Country game. The Donkey Kong Country sub-series started in 1994 with the release of the original game on the Super Nintendo. Donkey Kong Country was a critical and commercial success, leading to the release of two direct sequels on the Super Nintendo.

title: Sony's Plan to Acquire FromSoftware's Parent Company May Have Hit a Snag
excerpt: Sony's rumored plans to purchase FromSoftware parent company Kadokawa might have hit a speedbump that could lead to no deal being made.
author: J Brodie Shirey
body:
Sony may have hit a speedbump in its supposed plans to acquire FromSoftware parent company Kadokawa, and it has to do with how expensive this purchase would be. Earlier this month, rumors started to spread of Sony looking to buy Kadokawa. Kadokawa has also ventured into other media like anime, which Sony has recently gained a foothold in thanks to its purchases of Crunchyroll and Funimation in recent years.

title: Genshin Impact Leak Teases New Dragon Character for Version 5.5
excerpt: Recent datamining in Genshin Impact unearths a curious piece of information, as Version 5.5 could see a major dragon character appear.
author: Christine Miller
body:

body:
The recent Sonic the Hedgehog 3 trailer and subsequent TV spots are packed with references to the original games, and some fans think they spotted an Easter egg nod to a mysterious character from the recent Sonic web videos. The third live-action Sonic the Hedgehog movie is finally hitting theaters on December 20 and will introduce theatergoers to Shadow the Hedgehog, as voiced by Hollywood megastar Keanu Reeves. The plot is loosely based on 2001’s , with Sonic and his friends facing off against the former’s dark doppelganger in a battle to save the planet.

title: Australia Social Media Ban is Officially Happening

title: The Thing: Remastered Release Date Possibly Leaked
excerpt: The Thing: Remastered's release date appears online before an official announcement from the publisher can be made.
author: Dalton Cooper
body:
KEY TAKEAWAYS
The release date for The Thing: Remastered is reportedly set for December 5, according to Xbox.
The remastered version promises enhanced graphics and performance improvements.
Nightdive Studios, known for quality remasters, is handling The Thing: Remastered.
It looks as though The Thing: Remastered will be launching on Thursday, December 5. The Thing: Remastered is the remastered version of the 2002 video game based on John Carpenter's classic sci-fi horror movie The Thing. The Thing was a hit back when it released in 2002, with many praising it as one of the better survival-horror games of the era.
Considering the commercial success of The Thing video game, it's no surprise that there was some demand for it to be remastered for modern platforms. Nightdive Studios has stepped up to remaster The Thing, promising to deliver the game before the end of the year. With 2024 nearly at an end, no specific release date has been announced. However, it seems as though the cat has been let out of the bag.
RELATED
The Thing (1982) Ending, Explained
The end of 1982's The Thing has confused fans for decades at this point, so what exactly happens?
Xbox recently published a post highlighting upcoming games for its platforms. As spotted by Pure Xbox, the post includes a December 5 release date for The Thing: Remastered, along with confirmation that the game is optimized for Xbox Series X/S consoles and supports Smart Delivery. It's quite possible that this release date is inaccurate, but there's also a chance that it is indeed the release date for The Thing: Remastered. With December 5 right around the corner, fans won't have to wait long to find out, in any case.
The Thing: Remastered Rumored Release Date
Thursday, December 5
For those unfamiliar with the game, The Thing video game serves as a sequel to the movie. Players are tasked with exploring the outpost from the movie to figure out what happened to the research team that was stationed there, only to find themselves having to fight off the titular "thing." Blending survival-horror and third-person shooter elements, The Thing was mostly well-received at the time of its release in 2002.
The Thing: Remastered is bringing various enhancements to the table that should help the game reach a modern audience. The big thing is that The Thing: Remastered will feature better graphics than the original, but it will also enjoy improved performance and will be addressing some complaints fans had about the original. Notably, the wonky Infection system from the original game is being addressed by The Thing: Remastered, which should go a long way in improving the overall experience.
Fans of The Thing can rest assured that the remaster is in good hands. Nightdive Studios has built a reputation for delivering high-quality remasters of old-school games, and there's no reason to assume that the same won't hold true for The Thing: Remastered, whether it release on December 5 or a different date entirely.
Your Rating

10/10
The Thing
The Thing takes place shortly after Carpenter's 1982 film and plays off of many of the same themes of mood, distrust, fear, and monstrous baddies. It plays out as FPS as you try to determine what has happened and who in your team has become infected.

According to a Ubisoft insider, the company, along with many others, wants Steam to hide concurrent player data.

title: Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel Launches Limited-Time "Time Travel" Event
excerpt: Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel rolls out its newest limited-time "Time Travel" Duel Trial event, featuring a popular retro format based on an influential set.
author: Michael Brandon Ingram
body:
KEY TAKEAWAYS
Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel rolls out its new "Time Travel 2014" Duel Trial event, featuring a retro format based on the release of the "Duelist Alliance" set.
Players can use one of three Loaner Decks featuring popular archetypes like "HERO" and "Satellarknight" or build their own decks based on the format.
Winning three duels in the event rewards players with a free pack of Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel's newest Selection Pack, "Geas of the Light."
Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel has officially launched its newest "Time Travel" Duel Trial event, bringing players back to the release of one of the game's most influential sets. Konami has experimented with a wide variety of different events throughout the nearly three-year-long life of the digital version of its massively popular trading card game. Each month typically features one to two major Master Duel events, focusing around different deck-building restrictions, while smaller "Duel Trial" events utilize unique gimmicks for unusual dueling strategies. Now, Konami has rolled out its newest Duel Trial event.
While Duel Trials have taken many different forms since their introduction to Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel, "Time Travel" events have been a particularly popular variant of the mini-event. Konami first debuted the "Time Travel 2004" event in March, bringing players back to the early days of the game and the iconic "GOAT" format. Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel would follow up on the idea during the summer, with "Time Travel 2010" featuring a banlist and cardpool based on the popular "Edison" format. The newest Duel Trial format takes inspiration from a game-changing set in Yu-Gi-Oh's history.
RELATED
Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel Announces New Limited-Time Event
Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel reveals the newest limited-time event coming to the game, featuring a return to one of the game's beloved retro formats.
Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel debuted its newest "Duel Trial" event on Thursday night, introducing the "Time Travel 2014" mini-event. The event features a format based on the release of Yu-Gi-Oh's "Duelist Alliance" set, featuring the debut of iconic archetypes like "Shaddoll" and "Satellarknight," while utilizing the June 2014 banlist. The event provides players with three different Loaner decks based on themes like "HERO" and "Dragons," while also allowing players to use their own decks. Winning three duels during the event rewards players with a free pack of Master Duel's newest Selection Pack, "Geas of the Light."
Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel Launches "Time Travel 2014" Event
The format for Master Duel's "Time Travel 2014" marks one of the most notable turning points in the Yu-Gi-Oh TCG's history. The event's cardpool comes just following the debut of Pendulum Monsters, ushering in a new era of gameplay with more explosive combos and powerful new cards. "Shaddoll" also took over the game as one of Yu-Gi-Oh's most dominant decks, owed to boss Monsters like "El Shaddoll Winda" and "El Shaddoll Construct." Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel's "Time Travel 2014" event will run through the morning of December 3.
Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel's newest event is far from the only change arriving to the digital trading card game in the coming weeks. Konami recently unveiled the newest banlist update for Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel, banning powerful draw Spell "Pot of Prosperity" and limiting cards like "Fairy Tail - Snow" and "Dimension Shifter." December is also expected to welcome new Selection Packs to the game, introducing even more cards to the online TCG. Master Duel's new event looks to bring back one of the defining moments in Yu-Gi-Oh history for a limited time.

The full Yu-Gi-Oh! experience is available for anyone at any Skill Level. Don't worry if you're a new player or if you haven't Dueled in a while, the in-game tutorials will teach you the basics on how to play the Yu-Gi-Oh! TRADING CARD GAME. You'll be given a Deck when you finish to help you start your journey!

Mix it up and put your Dueling skills to the test! A wide variety of events and tournaments will be available for players.

Build and Duel with different Decks utilizing 10,000+ unique cards and special rules unique to Tournaments!

Choose the tournament YOU want to Duel in and aim for that number one spot!

The Solo Mode guides you through storylines of the themes from the Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG. Hone your Dueling skills by completing the stories.

Recommended for beginners, returning players, and those of you who are interested in learning more about the lore of the world of the Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG.

The format for Master Duel's "Time Travel 2014" marks one of the most notable turning points in the Yu-Gi-Oh TCG's history. The event's cardpool comes just following the debut of Pendulum Monsters, ushering in a new era of gameplay with more explosive combos and powerful new cards. "Shaddoll" also took over the game as one of Yu-Gi-Oh's most dominant decks, owed to boss Monsters like "El Shaddoll Winda" and "El Shaddoll Construct." Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel's "Time Travel 2014" event will run through the morning of December 3.
Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel's newest event is far from the only change arriving to the digital trading card game in the coming weeks. Konami recently unveiled the newest banlist update for Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel, banning powerful draw Spell "Pot of Prosperity" and limiting cards like "Fairy Tail - Snow" and "Dimension Shifter." December is also expected to welcome new Selection Packs to the game, introducing even more cards to the online TCG. Master Duel's new event looks to bring back one of the defining moments in Yu-Gi-Oh history for a limited time.

Yu-Gi-Oh! Master Duel
Now you can play the "Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG" digitally, anywhere.
Fast-paced Duels with stunning HD graphics and a new, dynamic soundtrack! Get ready to challenge Duelists around the world!

The full Yu-Gi-Oh! experience is available for anyone at any Skill Level. Don't worry if you're a new player or if you haven't Dueled in a while, the in-game tutorials will teach you the basics on how to play the Yu-Gi-Oh! TRADING CARD GAME. You'll be given a Deck when you finish to help you start your journey!

Mix it up and put your Dueling skills to the test! A wide variety of events and tournaments will be available for players.

Build and Duel with different Decks utilizing 10,000+ unique cards and special rules unique to Tournaments!

Choose the tournament YOU want to Duel in and aim for that number one spot!

The Solo Mode guides you through storylines of the themes from the Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG. Hone your Dueling skills by completing the stories.

Recommended for beginners, returning players, and those of you who are interested in learning more about the lore of the world of the Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG.

title: Call of Duty: Warzone Changing Area 99 Player Count
excerpt: The Warzone team confirms the total number of players able to drop into Area 99 has been cut following the map's release earlier this month.
author: Luke Dammann
body:
Call of Duty: Warzone is shrinking the size of matches significantly just a little over a week after launching its newest map, Area 99. The new Warzone map was released alongside Call of Duty: Black Ops 6's Season 1 content update, which made many tweaks and changes to the game's multiplayer component. Season 1 introduced players to the new world of Call of Duty: Warzone, with Area 99 being a completely new battle royale arena. However, the map seemingly has not been performing the way developers anticipated, with the maximum number of players getting cut across the board.

Sonic X Shadow Generations selling over a million units isn't too surprising, considering how it was one of the most anticipated releases for Sonic the Hedgehog fans in 2024. While it includes a remaster of 2011's , there is also a campaign starring Shadow the Hedgehog, where he faces off against Black Doom and other enemies from his past. Shadow being the protagonist of his own journey adjacent to gave the remaster a lot of attention it otherwise likely wouldn't have gotten.

body:
A promotional video for The Last of Us: Remastered resurfaced to show Ellie's dramatic transformation throughout the course of the first two games. The Last of Us made its debut on June 14, 2013, and has been treated to many remasters, remakes, and sequels. Originally released for the PlayStation 3, the title was quick to jump into the PlayStation 4 era with The Last of Us: Remastered on July 29, 2014, and then completely remade and sold again in 2022, while the sequel was remastered and rereleased in 2024.

title: World of Warcraft Reveals Why Recent Events Have All Been Buffed After Launch

title: Online Gaming Spared from Social Media Ban Bill
excerpt: The proposed social media ban in Australia for users under the age of 16 will reportedly not including online gaming platforms like the PSN.

body:
A new bill from the Australian government proposing a ban on social media for users under the age of 16 will reportedly not affect the PlayStation Network, according to a recent report. Social media platforms have often been a hot-button issue for government authorities, with special concern given to the potential for younger children to use the platform. Last month saw thirteen U.S. states and the District of Columbia file , contesting the platform's claims as being "safe for children." Now, the Australian government is gearing up to take things a step further.

title: Xbox Getting Rid of Modern Avatar Feature

body:
Microsoft has announced that the modern Xbox avatar editor feature will be discontinued starting in January 2025. Xbox's Avatar feature is similar to Nintendo's Miis. Xbox avatars are used as playable characters in various games like Kinect Sports, Tony Hawk's Pro Skater HD, and Sonic Free Riders, among others. The Avatar feature originally debuted on the Xbox 360 as part of a "New Play" experience update back in 2008, and has since been a consistent part of the brand's identity.

body:
The Nintendo Switch version of Yakuza Kiwami has released a new update, bringing the game to version 1.01 with some improvements to the port. Yakuza Kiwami is a remake of the first game in Sega's long-running series. While Kiwami was first released in 2016 on PlayStation consoles, it was later brought to the Nintendo Switch eight years later, via a surprise announcement during the August 2024 Nintendo Direct. marks the first time that a Nintendo console has gotten a game since the Japan-only HD collection package, , back in 2013.

title: The Reason Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 is Being Review-Bombed
excerpt: The launch of Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 on November 19 has been met with widespread criticism due to severe performance issues, resulting in a steep decline in its player base. Unlike the well-received 2020 release, this sequel has struggled with technical problems such as lengthy wait times and persistent server errors, including a notorious 97% loading bug that prevents many players from accessing the game. One user reported being stuck in this loading loop for over an hour.
author: Lauren Beeler-Beistad
question:
The Reason Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 is Being Review-Bombed

The launch of Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 on November 19 has been met with widespread criticism due to severe performance issues, resulting in a steep decline in its player base. Unlike the well-received 2020 release, this sequel has struggled with technical problems such as lengthy wait times and persistent server errors, including a notorious 97% loading bug that prevents many players from accessing the game. One user reported being stuck in this loading loop for over an hour.
answer: Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 has been review-bombed due to severe performance issues, including lengthy wait times, server errors, and a notorious 97% loading bug, causing a decline in its player base. The game's sequel has struggled to match the success of its 2020 release, leaving many players frustrated with the technical problems.

title: Cozy Survival Title Coming to Game Pass Gets New Trailer
excerpt: One of Xbox Game Pass' 2025 day one titles receives a cute new gameplay trailer showcasing what fans can come to expect when it releases.
author: John Bonelli
body:
KEY TAKEAWAYS
Winter Burrow, coming to Xbox Game Pass in 2025, offers cozy survival gameplay in a snowy woodland.
The new trailer showcases resource gathering, crafting, combat with insects, and friendly NPC interactions.
Winter Burrow, a cozy new survival game due to launch day one on Xbox Game Pass next year, has released an all-new trailer. This new look at the game highlights some of Winter Burrow's survival elements, as well as the game's exploration mechanics as players explore a cute yet harsh snowy woodland.
First revealed at Xbox's June Summer Game Fest showcase, Winter Burrow caught the eye of cozy game fans for its cute mouse protagonist and snowy winter environments. However, in the grand scheme of what's considered one of Xbox's best showcases ever, it wouldn't be wrong to say that Winter Burrow may have been overshadowed a bit by the likes of Perfect Dark and South of Midnight's gameplay reveals, announcements of Gears of War: E-Day and Doom: The Dark Ages, and so much more. Still, Winter Burrow has remained on Xbox Game Pass subscribers' wish lists and many are eager to see and learn more about the game.
RELATED
Xbox Game Pass Ultimate Adds More Perks for November 2024
Xbox's popular Game Pass subscription service reveals this month's round of perks and goodies users can claim at no additional cost.
Fans of survival games are in luck today, as Winter Burrow has put out an all-new trailer, giving fans an in-depth look at the survival game's mechanics. The two-minute trailer is narrated by a developer from Pine Creek Games, the studio behind Winter Burrow, who sheds some light on the game's early narrative setup. The trailer gives fans a glimpse at the game's UI, which looks to include a compass, item belt, and what seem like health, hunger, and warmth bars in the lower left corner. The burrow, which will serve as players' home base, was a big focus of the trailer. It's here where players will be able to craft items, knit sweaters to keep warm in the cold, bake pies to eat, and rest up for the next day of scavenging.
Day One Game Pass Title Winter Burrow Releases New Trailer
Your browser does not support the video tag.
The areas outside the burrow are where players will need to explore in order to gather resources like wood, rocks, and other materials. However, players will need to contend with both the freezing cold weather and creepy critters like beetles and bugs that will need to be dealt with through what seems like a simple, light combat system. Not all the creatures outside the burrow are hostile though, as the trailer showed some of the friendly NPC animals players can meet, like a bear and a frog, who may be of help with useful survival tips. It seems like Winter Burrow's gameplay loop will involve going out to explore and gather resources before heading back to the burrow to rest up and prepare for the next outing.
Winter Burrow's new trailer didn't divulge a specific release date; it's sticking with its initial 2025 window. Considering the game's cozy winter setting, it would be a perfect game for January or February. Nevertheless, Steam users can wishlist the game and can also try out the game's demo, while Xbox users will have to wait for the game's full launch, which will be part of Xbox Game Pass on day one.
5 Images
Winter Burrow
Winter Burrow is a cozy woodland survival game. Explore, gather resources, craft tools, knit warm sweaters, bake pies and meet the locals!

In Winter Burrow, you play a mouse who returns from the big city to find their childhood home in ruins. To make matters worse, your Aunt (who was supposed to be looking after it) has gone missing. Restore your broken-down childhood burrow to its former glory so you can relax in front of the fireplace.


Brave the elements and journey out into the frozen wilderness to collect vital resources for both yourself and your new home. Beware of the insect wildlife and remember that nobody survives on their own; find new friends, expand your survival handbook and solve the mystery of what happened to your Aunt.


Winter Burrow is a survival game you play at your own pace. Customize your character, decorate your burrow and choose a path that fits your play style. This story is yours to tell.

question:
Cozy Survival Title Coming to Game Pass Gets New Trailer

One of Xbox Game Pass' 2025 day one titles receives a cute new gameplay trailer showcasing what fans can come to expect when it releases.
KEY TAKEAWAYS
Winter Burrow, coming to Xbox Game Pass in 2025, offers cozy survival gameplay in a snowy woodland.
The new trailer showcases resource gathering, crafting, combat with insects, and friendly NPC interactions.
Winter Burrow, a cozy new survival game due to launch day one on Xbox Game Pass next year, has released an all-new trailer. This new look at the game highlights some of Winter Burrow's survival elements, as well as the game's exploration mechanics as players explore a cute yet harsh snowy woodland.
First revealed at Xbox's June Summer Game Fest showcase, Winter Burrow caught the eye of cozy game fans for its cute mouse protagonist and snowy winter environments. However, in the grand scheme of what's considered one of Xbox's best showcases ever, it wouldn't be wrong to say that Winter Burrow may have been overshadowed a bit by the likes of Perfect Dark and South of Midnight's gameplay reveals, announcements of Gears of War: E-Day and Doom: The Dark Ages, and so much more. Still, Winter Burrow has remained on Xbox Game Pass subscribers' wish lists and many are eager to see and learn more about the game.
RELATED
Xbox Game Pass Ultimate Adds More Perks for November 2024
Xbox's popular Game Pass subscription service reveals this month's round of perks and goodies users can claim at no additional cost.
Fans of survival games are in luck today, as Winter Burrow has put out an all-new trailer, giving fans an in-depth look at the survival game's mechanics. The two-minute trailer is narrated by a developer from Pine Creek Games, the studio behind Winter Burrow, who sheds some light on the game's early narrative setup. The trailer gives fans a glimpse at the game's UI, which looks to include a compass, item belt, and what seem like health, hunger, and warmth bars in the lower left corner. The burrow, which will serve as players' home base, was a big focus of the trailer. It's here where players will be able to craft items, knit sweaters to keep warm in the cold, bake pies to eat, and rest up for the next day of scavenging.
Day One Game Pass Title Winter Burrow Releases New Trailer
Your browser does not support the video tag.
The areas outside the burrow are where players will need to explore in order to gather resources like wood, rocks, and other materials. However, players will need to contend with both the freezing cold weather and creepy critters like beetles and bugs that will need to be dealt with through what seems like a simple, light combat system. Not all the creatures outside the burrow are hostile though, as the trailer showed some of the friendly NPC animals players can meet, like a bear and a frog, who may be of help with useful survival tips. It seems like Winter Burrow's gameplay loop will involve going out to explore and gather resources before heading back to the burrow to rest up and prepare for the next outing.
Winter Burrow's new trailer didn't divulge a specific release date; it's sticking with its initial 2025 window. Considering the game's cozy winter setting, it would be a perfect game for January or February. Nevertheless, Steam users can wishlist the game and can also try out the game's demo, while Xbox users will have to wait for the game's full launch, which will be part of Xbox Game Pass on day one.
5 Images
Winter Burrow
Winter Burrow is a cozy woodland survival game. Explore, gather resources, craft tools, knit warm sweaters, bake pies and meet the locals!

In Winter Burrow, you play a mouse who returns from the big city to find their childhood home in ruins. To make matters worse, your Aunt (who was supposed to be looking after it) has gone missing. Restore your broken-down childhood burrow to its former glory so you can relax in front of the fireplace.


Brave the elements and journey out into the frozen wilderness to collect vital resources for both yourself and your new home. Beware of the insect wildlife and remember that nobody survives on their own; find new friends, expand your survival handbook and solve the mystery of what happened to your Aunt.


Winter Burrow is a survival game you play at your own pace. Customize your character, decorate your burrow and choose a path that fits your play style. This story is yours to tell.

The game follows a mouse protagonist who returns to their childhood home in ruins and must restore it to its former glory while uncovering the mystery of their Aunt's disappearance. Winter Burrow is set to release on Xbox Game Pass in 2025 as a day one title.

title: Helldivers 2 'Looking Into' Highly-Requested Feature
excerpt: The creative director for Helldivers 2 confirms that Arrowhead is looking into a way for players to utilize a new customization option.
author: Matthew O’Dwyer
body:
KEY TAKEAWAYS
Johan Pilestedt, the creative director of Helldivers 2, confirmed that players may soon be able to customize the color of their armor.
Unfortunately, a full transmog system won't be coming to the game.
Creative director Johan Pilestedt has confirmed that Helldivers 2 may add a highly requested feature that would allow players to customize the color of their armor. Customization has been a constant talking point among fans of the popular shooter. Players have asked for the ability to recolor their armor, or even fully customize loadouts with a transmog system, for quite some time. Helldivers 2 has also fallen under occasional scrutiny for failing to meet the cosmetic demands of its voracious fanbase.
Helldivers 2 is a co-op third-person shooter that allows up to four players to fight off the tyranny of automatons and terminids in the name of Super Earth and democracy. The breakout hit was released early in 2024 and immediately struck a chord with fans for its fast-paced action, tense gameplay, and wide range of weapons. The title courted controversy with its PC version when Sony decided to require PlayStation accounts for Steam players, but that hasn't stopped the game from continuing to grow its fanbase. The Game Awards have even nominated the shooter in several categories for 2024.
RELATED
Helldivers 2's Missing Illuminate Faction Might Set an Unfortunate Precedent
The anticipated Illuminate faction still nowhere to be seen in Helldivers 2 might be an unfortunate sign regarding a particular aspect of the game.
A fan of Helldivers 2 tagged the creative director of the game in a post on Twitter. It was day 16 of the fan asking for the ability to customize their Helldiver's armor by recoloring it, and Pilestedt responded by saying the Helldivers 2 team was "looking into it." While this doesn't confirm any sort of timeline for the requested feature, it looks like players may have a new level of customization to look forward to in the future. The game already features a lot of ways for players to customize their characters and interact with one another, especially when it comes to including interactive emotes in Helldivers 2. Adding even more options would likely continue to win over players and keep the fanbase happy.
Helldivers 2 May Soon Let Players Customize the Color of Their Armor
It's important to note that allowing players to recolor their armor would not be the same as a full transmog system. Shortly after release, the creative director stated the customization feature wouldn't make sense for Helldivers 2. Pilestedt believes the game's varied armors often look different because they serve different purposes, meaning a transmog system wouldn't fit the developer's vision.
Many fans feel the option to recolor one's armor would be a welcome addition to the popular action game. Helldivers 2 recently increased its in-game store prices, which didn't go over well with some players. However, the ability to further customize armor might make those prices a little easier to swallow. While customizing colors isn't quite the full transmog system some players have been asking for, it would be a bit of a compromise on the part of Arrowhead.

Helldivers 2
Do you believe in freedom? Can you stand in the face of oppression – and defend the defenceless? Wage war for peace. Die for democracy.
  Join forces with up to three friends and wreak havoc on an alien scourge threatening the safety of your home planet, Super Earth, in this multiplayer co-op shooter for PS5 and PC from Arrowhead Game Studios. 
  Step into the boots of the Helldivers, an elite class of soldiers whose mission is to spread peace, liberty and Managed Democracy using the biggest, baddest and most explosive tools in the galaxy. 
  Helldivers don't go planet side without proper backup, but it’s up to you to decide how and when to call it in. Not only do you have a host of superpowered primary weapons and customizable loadouts, you also have the ability to call on stratagems during play. 
  Helldivers 2 features Arrowhead's best cooperative gameplay yet. Collaboration will be vital: Teams will synergize on loadouts, strategize their approach for each mission and complete objectives together.1
  Enlist in Super Earth’s premier military peacekeeping force today. We are heroes… we are legends… WE ARE HELLDIVERS.

title: Final Fantasy 14 Mobile is Taking Things Back to 2013
excerpt: The upcoming Final Fantasy 14 Mobile will give fans a trip down memory lane, as the game will launch with how things were back in 2013.

body:
In a recent interview, Final Fantasy 14 producer and director Naoki Yoshida confirmed that the upcoming Final Fantasy 14 Mobile will kick off with the main story of A Realm Reborn, and will feature the Jobs and races found in the game in its 2013 relaunch. Yoshida added that Final Fantasy 14 Mobile would be a free-to-play experience with Square Enix's supervision.

title: Death Stranding 2 Bringing Back Conan O'Brien
excerpt: Late-night TV host Conan O'Brien gets invited to make another cameo appearance in Death Stranding 2: On the Beach following his role in the original.
author: J Brodie Shirey
body:
Late-night comedian Conan O’Brien is coming back for another cameo in Death Stranding 2: On the Beach. The original Death Stranding featured a cast of Hollywood celebrities like Norman Reedus, Mads Mikkelsen, and Lea Seydoux, as well as big-name voice actors like Troy Baker. Reedus, Seydoux, and Baker are all reprising their roles in the upcoming Death Stranding 2, which will add Elle Fanning and Shioli Kutsuna alongside the digital likenesses of directors George Miller and Fatih Akin.

title: Fortnite Battle Pass Is Getting More Expensive
excerpt: The Fortnite Battle Pass receives its first in-game price increase, meaning it will no longer only cost 950 V-Bucks to gain access to it.
author: Ashely Claudino
body:
The Fortnite Battle Pass will cost 1,000 V-Bucks starting on December 1, 2024, making the Chapter 6 Battle Pass the first to cost more than 950 V-Bucks. Fortnite players have always been able to purchase the Battle Pass with 950 V-Bucks, which would then allow them to earn it all back and then some by reaching level 100. Over time, Epic Games has made it harder for gamers to get their in-game currency back by lowering the number of quests and XP methods available and by giving V-Bucks as Bonus Rewards, meaning gamers had to reach a higher season level in to get all the Battle Pass V-Bucks.

title: Deadpool And Other Delisted Games Get Mysterious Updates On Steam
excerpt: Despite being delisted years ago, 2013's Deadpool and a handful of other licensed Activision games receive a small update on Steam.
author: J Brodie Shirey
body:
Multiple delisted, Activision-published licensed titles have recently been updated on Steam, including 2013’s Deadpool. Before Ryan Reynolds helped bring the Merc with a Mouth into the mainstream with the live-action Deadpool films, Transformers: War of Cybertron developer High Moon Studios released a stand-alone video game chronicling the adventures of Wade Wilson for the seventh and eighth console generations. While gained cult status among comic book gaming fans, it was eventually delisted from Steam and other online outlets due to Activision losing its Marvel license in 2014, though it briefly returned to promote the first film in 2015.

title: PlayStation Portal Update Allows Users to Play Some Games Without a PS5, But There's a Catch
excerpt: A new firmware update for the PlayStation Portal allows users to play certain games without the need for a PS5, but there's a catch.
author: Kyle Knight
body:
The PlayStation Portal has received a new system update that adds support for cloud streaming for select PS5 games, but the feature itself is still in beta. At launch, the PlayStation Portal allowed users to stream their PlayStation 5 games directly to the handheld device from anywhere in the world, as long as both devices had a stable internet connection. Now, thanks to the handheld device's latest update, fans can stream certain games straight to the Portal without the need for a PS5 console, but a PlayStation Plus Premium subscription is required.

title: Major Twitch Advertisers Reportedly Leave the Platform
excerpt: Several advertisers apparently begin to jump ship from Twitch after the livestreaming platform is beset by a series of controversies.
author: Pam K Ferdinand
body:
Twitch is reportedly losing a number of advertisers after the platform was recently accused of antisemitism. In October 2024, it came to light that people attempting to create a Twitch account from Israel or Palestine were being blocked. In a Twitter post, the company confirmed that, following the attacks on Israel on October 7, 2023, it had temporarily disabled new account email verifications from these locations. The goal was to prevent potentially graphic material from being shared. However, Twitch clarified that people could still verify sign-ups using a phone number from Israel or Palestine, though anecdotal evidence seemed to contradict that claim.

title: Call of Duty: Warzone Update Nerfs Useful Tactical Equipment

body:

title: Silent Hill 2 Remake Players Are Running Into Issues on PS5 Pro

author: Trumann Tu
body:
Silent Hill 2 remake players have been calling out Konami to fix some of the technical issues that are still affecting the game when played on the PlayStation 5 Pro console. The 2024 Silent Hill 2 remake was released for both PS5 and PC earlier this October, featuring a lot of modernized features and overhauled combat compared to the original games. The game sold a million copies within its launch period and was praised by both fans and critics for being a great remake in general. Despite its positive impressions, the game isn't completely blemish-free, as it has had some issues after launch.

title: Sonic Adventure Games Will Be Delisted in Two Countries Soon
excerpt: Sega is delisting two more games soon, as eagle-eyed fans spot that both Sonic Adventure titles will be delisted in two countries later this year.
author: Trumann Tu
body:
Sega has suddenly announced that both Sonic Adventure titles will be delisted from the Xbox and Steam platforms in Germany and Italy on December 7. Both Sonic Adventure and its sequel are considered the quintessential Sonic the Hedgehog games and, depending on the fan, possibly the best of the franchise's 3D titles. While both were originally released on the Sega Dreamcast, they were eventually brought over to other platforms, starting with the Nintendo GameCube, and later the PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, and PC via Steam. It appears that the Steam and Xbox 360 versions of the games are going to be delisted in a couple of countries soon.

title: Walmart Testing New Method of Dealing With Locked Up Products
excerpt: Insiders reveal that Walmart is testing out a new way to give customers easier access to the growing number of products locked up behind glass.
author: Pam K Ferdinand
body:
Walmart is trying out a new way to give potential customers access to locked-up products while still effectively hindering theft. In recent years, many consumers have noticed a growing, and sometimes frustrating, trend: the products they want to purchase in stores like Walmart or Target are trapped behind glass doors, locked up tight. To get their hands on the coveted deodorant, baby formula, or mascara, would-be buyers must hit a buzzer and wait for an ambling employee to help. Or, worse yet, getting into these product prisons often requires wandering aimlessly for several minutes in the hopes of bumping into a staff member with a key.

title: Xbox Boss Phil Spencer Comments on Licensed Games

body:

Bethesda's upcoming Indiana Jones and the Great Circle will be released on December 9, launching on the Xbox consoles and PC first, with a PlayStation 5 port coming later in 2025. The Great Circle is the first licensed game since 2011's .

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is the newest in a long line of first-person shooters that commit to simulating war while incorporating blockbuster action movie-styled visuals. title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Makes Controversial Changes to Battle Pass With Season 1

author: Kyle Knight
body:
Activision has made a controversial change to Call of Duty's Battle Pass with the launch of Black Ops 6 Season 1, as progressing through the Pass now only returns a total of 1,100 COD Points, as opposed to the previous amount of 1,400. title: Andor Season 2 is Making an Old Star Wars Video Game Ship Canon
excerpt: The upcoming second season of Andor is bringing a classic spaceship from a fan-favorite series of Star Wars video games into Disney's official canon.
author: J Brodie Shirey
body:
The upcoming second season of Andor is bringing the TIE Avenger from the old Star Wars X-Wing video games into Disney’s official canon. Like much of the expanded universe material made before 2014, the classic Star Wars video games were shuffled off into their own Legends timeline to make room for the Sequel Trilogy and other Disney-produced Star Wars works, but this hasn’t stopped elements from appearing in canon shows, movies, and games since.

title: New Baldur's Gate 3 Update is Only for PS5 and Xbox Gamers
excerpt: Baldur's Gate 3 developer Larian Studios confirms an update is on the way that seeks to address performance issues for console players.
author: Luke Dammann
body:
A newly announced Baldur's Gate 3 update is coming, but only for console players. The new hotfix seeks to address issues players face when using 100 or more mods at once in Baldur's Gate 3. Mod support is fairly new for console versions of Baldur's Gate 3, but it has remained a core component of the game for PC players since the game was released last year. Baldur's Gate 3's newest update is intended to make using player-created add-ons easier for console players.

title: AMD Hit With Layoffs
excerpt: AMD, the maker of graphics cards for PC as well as Xbox and PlayStation chips, announces that it's laying off some of its employees.
author: Aaron McKinley
body:
AMD has announced that it is laying off 4 percent of its workforce. The semiconductor giant produces processors and graphics cards for gaming PCs and consoles like Xbox and PlayStation, but the chip market has shifted toward AI in recent years. Now, AMD is leaning into that trend as its gaming division struggles to maintain the sales it used to see.

title: Mortal Kombat 1 Fans Think They've Figured Out Ghostface's Identity
excerpt: Longtime Mortal Kombat players think that Mortal Kombat 1's version of the dreaded Ghostface is actually two obscure characters from past entries.
author: J Brodie Shirey
body:
Ghostface will soon strike in Mortal Kombat 1, and some fans think they’ve managed to unmask the killer(s) as two relatively obscure Kombatants from past games. Mortal Kombat 1 has seen plenty of guest fighters, and the Ghostface killer from the Scream franchise will join them on November 19. As any fan of the Scream movies can attest, part of the terror of Ghostface is the notion that it could be anyone under the iconic Fun World “Peanut-Eyed Ghost” mask, and there is usually more than one Ghostface active at a time.

title: Fortnite Gives Shark Island an Ice Spice-Themed Makeover
excerpt: Fortnite gets an Ice Spice-themed makeover in the game's latest update, transforming one of the map's islands into a neon-lit shopping mall.
author: Luke Dammann
body:
Ice Spice is the latest musical artist to take over Fortnite, with the game introducing a brand-new area inspired by the 4x Grammy nominee as part of Chapter 2 Remix's third week. Shark Island has become Ice Isle, a neon-soaked haven ripe for exploration. Additionally, Ice Spice serves as inspiration for several new weapons and items, making the latest update for Fortnite one players won't want to miss out on.

title: Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered Release New Update for November 2024
excerpt: Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered gets a new update for November 2024, addressing a variety of bugs and technical issues for the PC port.
author: J Brodie Shirey
body:
Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered just received a new update for November 2024, providing a variety of bug fixes and technical improvements across the board. The original Horizon Zero Dawn was released for the PlayStation 4 back in 2017 and introduced gamers to the ongoing saga of Aloy and her journey to find her place in a post-apocalyptic world filled with animal-like machines. Guerrilla Games and Nixxes Software released a remastered version for the PlayStation 5 and PC on October 31, allowing fans to reexperience the story of with updated graphics and new accessibility features.

title: Phil Spencer Reveals Main Reason for Avowed Delay
excerpt: Microsoft Gaming CEO Phil Spencer explains the main reason for the delay of Obsidian Entertainment's upcoming action role-playing game, Avowed.
author: Kyle Knight
body:
Microsoft Gaming CEO Phil Spencer has explained the reasoning behind Avowed's delay, stating that the upcoming action role-playing game from Obsidian Entertainment wasn't pushed back to give the studio more time, but rather to pace out the number of games coming to Xbox's lucrative Game Pass service. Avowed will be the next big RPG to come from the studio, and was originally scheduled to launch in Fall 2024 before being pushed back to February 18, 2025.

title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Player Discovers Serious Suppressor Bug
excerpt: A Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 player discovers a serious multiplayer bug that can make using a suppressor completely pointless.
author: Kyle Knight
body:
A YouTuber has uncovered a serious bug with Call of Duty: Black Ops 6's suppressors, revealing that players using the attachment are not being hidden from enemy radars if an opponent is using the Scout Pulse scorestreak. While suppressors aren't the most popular attachment to use in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6, the Scout Pulse is the lowest and most commonly used scorestreak in the game, meaning those who are using a suppressor are likely wasting their time.

title: Saudi Arabia Reduces Stake in Nintendo

body:
The Public Investment Fund of Saudi Arabia has reduced its shares in Nintendo once again. The Saudi Arabian PIF has been investing in the gaming industry for years. title: EA Boss Could Be Jumping Ship to Disney
excerpt: Disney's search for its next CEO continues, with Electronic Arts boss Andrew Wilson reportedly being considered for the role.

body:

title: LEGO Horizon Adventures New Sylens Voice Actor Revealed
excerpt: LEGO Horizon Adventures confirms the voice actor who will be taking over for the late Lance Reddick as Aloy's mysterious on-and-off ally Sylens.
author: J Brodie Shirey
body:
Guerrilla Games has officially cast Star Trek alumni Tim Russ as the new voice of Sylens in LEGO Horizon Adventures. In the original Horizon Zero Dawn (which LEGO Horizon Adventures is a retelling of) and Horizon Forbidden West, the mysterious and calculating Sylens was played by Lance Reddick, who passed away in March 2023 at age 60 from coronary artery disease and atherosclerotic heart disease. His death caused fans of both and his performance as Commander Zavala in to pay tribute to him on social media and through in-game events, even as they wondered what the future would hold for his most popular gaming roles.

title: Australia Social Media Ban Would Impact Online Gaming Platforms
excerpt: In an attempt to impose restrictions on social media, the Australian government may implement new rules with consequences for Xbox and PlayStation.
author: Matthew O’Dwyer
body:
The Australian government, with support from both of its major parties, could pass restrictions on the online services of platforms like PlayStation and Xbox. Anthony Albanese has been the leader of the Labor Party since 2019 and became prime minister of Australia in 2022. In recent history, he has sought to impose heavy restrictions on the use of social media for users under the age of 16. and Xbox don't appear or function like traditional social media platforms, but they do offer services that could be caught up in the government's new rules.

title: Stellar Blade PC Port Gets a Release Window
excerpt: South Korean studio Shift Up provides an update on the PC version of Stellar Blade, which now has a tentative release window.
author: Dominik Bošnjak
body:
KEY TAKEAWAYS
The Stellar Blade PC port is targeting a 2025 release.
Shift Up expects Stellar Blade to do even better on PC than the PS5, where it sold over 1 million copies as of June 2024.
It's still unclear who will publish the game's PC version.
The Stellar Blade PC version now has an official release window, with Shift Up confirming that it's targeting a 2025 launch. The South Korean studio is naturally hoping that the move to another platform will add to Stellar Blade's sales tally, though it has yet to clarify some crucial details concerning the upcoming port.
The game itself initially launched for the PlayStation 5 in late April 2024. Shift Up revealed it was considering a Stellar Blade PC port in June 2024. The developer then confirmed it had committed to bringing the game to PC two months later.
RELATED
November 20 is Going to Be a Big Day for Stellar Blade Fans
Stellar Blade fans should mark November 20 on their calendars, as this will be a very special day for the popular action game.
4
Another update on the project was shared on November 12, just as Shift Up published its latest consolidated financial report. During a Q&A session that followed, a company representative was asked about the status of the Stellar Blade PC port and responded that this version of the game is currently targeting a 2025 release.
Shift Up Has Big Expectations For Stellar Blade PC Port
Asked about the game's PC prospects, the official confirmed that Shift Up has big expectations for the port. Between Valve's growing share of the AAA gaming market and the recent success of the somewhat mechanically similar Black Myth: Wukong on Steam, the South Korean studio anticipates that Stellar Blade will do well on PC. "We expect to see more success on PC than consoles," a company representative said.
We expect to see more success on PC than consoles.
As for what kind of baseline the studio is targeting, it last said that Stellar Blade sold one million copies on the PS5. The action game reached that milestone in late June 2024, about two months following its original release. While Shift Up did not provide a breakdown of its previously reported sales figure, Circana estimates that Stellar Blade was the top-selling game in the U.S. in April 2024, despite hitting the market at the very end of the month. Stateside consumers have hence seemingly significantly contributed to its global sales.
Stellar Blade PC Port's Publisher Remains Unclear
Another thing that Shift Up is yet to clarify is who will publish the game's PC version. PlayStation handled the distribution of the PS5 original, but that was only after Sony sought a timed exclusivity deal for Stellar Blade. This happened after former SIE Worldwide Studios President Shuhei Yoshida played a prototype of the game and advised the company to pursue a publishing deal with Shift Up in 2021. The collaboration allowed Stellar Blade to grow in scope, according to a March 2024 report from French YouTuber Julien Chieze. Stellar Blade's credits support this theory, as they give "special thanks" to Yoshida.
Source: Julien Chieze / YouTube

Ravaged by strange, powerful creatures, Earth has been abandoned, and what is left of the decimated human race has fled to a Colony in outer space. After travelling from the Colony, 7th Airborne Squad member EVE arrives on the desolate remains of our planet with a clear-cut mission: to save humankind by reclaiming Earth from the Naytiba – the malevolent force that has devastated it. But as EVE tackles the Naytiba one-by-one, piecing together the mysteries of the past in the ruins of human civilization, she realizes that her mission is far from straightforward. In fact, almost nothing is as it seems…

title: Pokemon Fan Creates Adorable Dratini Wood Carving
excerpt: A creative member of the Pokemon community shares a tiny wood carving depicting one of the most popular Dragon-type creatures.
author: Jack Webster
body:
KEY TAKEAWAYS
A creative Pokemon fan recently carved Dratini out of maple wood.
The community has been wowed by the handmade creation, noting that the beige coloring would make for a unique shiny version of the popular Pokemon.
A member of the Pokemon community with a passion for arts and crafts recently shared a small wood carving that they created featuring Dratini, a classic Dragon-type Pokemon from the original Gen 1 games. While not nearly as powerful as its fully evolved form Dragonite, Dratini is widely regarded among fans as one of the cutest Dragon-type critters that Pokemon fans can find.
Being an evolutionary predecessor to Dragonite, the first pseudo-legendary Pokemon that the franchise ever introduced, it's no surprise that Dratini and its family of evolved forms have frequently appeared in Pokemon fan artwork since the late 90s. Dragon-type enthusiasts and imaginative artists alike have collectively designed a plethora of alternative forms for Dragonite and its pre-evolutions over the years, from custom Mega Forms to regional variants and even alternate shiny versions.
RELATED
Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Announce Mid-November Tera Raid Battle
Pokemon Scarlet and Violet reveal the second Seven-Star Tera Raid battle trainers can challenge throughout November.
One member of the Pokemon community, known online as MediocrePlayer, recently shared something a bit different: a hand-made wood carving they created that depicts Dratini with astonishing accuracy. This tiny Dratini model quickly captured the hearts of thousands of Pokemon fans online, and boasts a beautiful beige color thanks to the maple wood that the model was carved from. Though the carefully carved shapes and curves speak to an incredible level of crafting skill, many admiring Pokemon fans appreciate the slightly alternative appearance that the wood color provides, with some viewing it as something that would make a nice alternate shiny form for the Pokemon.
Dratini Wood Carving Almost Looks Like a New Form
With Pokemon standing tall as the single highest-grossing media franchise of all time, its games, merchandise, and anime series continue to reach millions of people all around the world. As a result of both the series' vast influence, the franchise enjoys a remarkably creative fanbase. Fan artwork in all of its forms has persisted since the Gen 1 games and seems to have flourished even further in recent years as fans have been inspired to create new forms of their favorite Pokemon thanks to the introduction of features such as regional variants and Paradox Pokemon in the games.
Even during the unusually long period between Pokemon Scarlet and Violet's DLC and the launch of Pokemon Legends: Z-A in 2025, the community has been busy bringing their imagination to life through artwork. While fans have seen little news with regard to the next major Pokemon release, this has left them all the more excited to see the new creature designs and Mega Forms that may appear in the Kalos region next year in Pokemon Legends: Z-A.
Pokemon
Pokemon is a franchise that needs no introduction. One of the most successful media empires in history, Pokemon spans games, television, films, manga, merchandise, music, and more.
  Created by
Satoshi Tajiri

title: It's the End of an Era for Call of Duty
excerpt: It is officially the end of an era for the long-running Call of Duty franchise.
author: Dalton Cooper
body:
The PlayStation exclusivity deals with Call of Duty have officially come to an end after a nine-year streak. Microsoft forged the original timed exclusivity deal with Call of Duty, securing Xbox 360 gamers early access to new multiplayer maps. 2014's Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare was the last game with Xbox timed-exclusivity, with PlayStation stepping in from 2015's onward.

question:
It's the End of an Era for Call of Duty

It is officially the end of an era for the long-running Call of Duty franchise.
The PlayStation exclusivity deals with Call of Duty have officially come to an end after a nine-year streak. Microsoft forged the original timed exclusivity deal with Call of Duty, securing Xbox 360 gamers early access to new multiplayer maps. 2014's Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare was the last game with Xbox timed-exclusivity, with PlayStation stepping in from 2015's onward.

body:

title: Ubisoft Sued by The Crew Players Over Server Shutdown
excerpt: Fans of Ubisoft's online-only racing game The Crew are suing developer and publisher Ubisoft for shuttering the game's servers.
author: Richard Swanson
body:
Two players of the online-only racing game The Crew are suing Ubisoft, the game's developer and publisher, over its shuttering of the game's servers, which effectively removed all access to the title. The Crew, released in 2014, was an online exclusive with no single-player campaign available for players without an internet connection. Shutting down the servers in December 2023 left owners of the game without the ability to utilize their purchased copies of the game.

The original creature designer of Pyramid Head in Silent Hill 2 finally answers a long-debated question among fans with an interesting origin story.
Finally laying to rest years of debate among fans, Silent Hill 2 art director Masahiro Ito has confirmed that Pyramid Head's design is not a creation of protagonist James Sunderland's mind but is instead an image from a painting brought to life. Silent Hill 2 players have long pondered whether the horrifyingly iconic appearance of Pyramid Head was from the mind of James or if it had a more complex origin, the latter of which has now been confirmed by the creature's creator.

answer: Silent Hill 2 art director Masahiro Ito has confirmed that Pyramid Head's design originated from a painting brought to life, rather than being a creation of James Sunderland's mind. This revelation settles a long-debated question among fans, providing a more complex and intriguing origin story for the character.

title: Hideo Kojima Reveals Origin Of Death Stranding Logo
excerpt: To honor the fifth anniversary of Death Stranding, creator Hideo Kojima reveals the surprising origin behind the game's surreal handprint logo.
author: J Brodie Shirey
body:
Legendary game designer Hideo Kojima recently shared some more secrets about Death Stranding, including how the game’s surreal logo is actually his own handprint. Death Stranding was the first game Kojima developed under his Kojima Productions studio after parting ways with Konami back in 2015, and the title was released for the PlayStation 4 in 2019. While 's slower-paced gameplay divided gamers, ample praise was given to its deep story, haunting atmosphere, and vocal performances from a star-studded cast that included star Norman Reedus as grizzled courier Sam Porter Bridges.

The PlayStation 5 Pro is an upgraded version of the PS5 with a faster GPU, deep learning-based image upscaling technology, and optimized games that can run at 4K and 60 FPS, along with an internal 2 TB storage. title: Insomniac Pays Tribute to Late Marvel's Spider-Man 2 Actor
excerpt: Following the news of Tony Todd's passing, Insomniac Games pays tribute to the late horror icon and Marvel's Spider-Man 2 Venom actor.
author: Trumann Tu
body:

title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Is Much More Successful Than Modern Warfare 3
excerpt: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 director confirms the latest shooter from Treyarch Studios is much more successful than its predecessor, Modern Warfare 3.
author: Kyle Knight
body:
Sales for Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 are up 60% on PlayStation and Steam when compared to last year's entry, Modern Warfare 3, according to Treyarch Studios developer Miles Leslie. While Black Ops 6 has been heavily praised by both fans and critics for its stellar campaign, Sledgehammer Games' previous Call of Duty title was blasted for its short and lackluster story mode, which is likely one of the reasons for its poor sales when compared to this year's entry.

title: Star Wars Episode 1: Jedi Power Battles Confirms 4 More Characters

author: Trumann Tu
body:
Aspyr and Lucasfilm Games confirmed four new playable characters for the upcoming Star Wars Episode 1: Jedi Power Battles remaster: Rifle Droid, Staff Tusken Raider, Ishi Tib, and Mercenary. Star Wars Episode 1: Jedi Power Battles was originally released back in 2000, and is set in the same time frame as The Phantom Menace. It was originally developed by LucasArts and released for the original PlayStation and later the Dreamcast. It is a mixture of a platformer and beat-em-up, featuring two-player co-op multiplayer as well.

title: Humankind Developer Amplitude Studios Splits from Sega
excerpt: Amplitude Studios, the developer behind Humankind, announces that it will be returning to the indie space after splitting its former owner, SEGA.
author: Matthew O’Dwyer
body:
Amplitude Studios has announced that it will be splitting from SEGA. The developer of Humankind is based out of Paris, France, and has been under the umbrella of SEGA Europe for eight years. Former Ubisoft employees Romain de Waubert de Genlis and Mathieu Girard established the studio in 2011. While the team’s origins were firmly rooted in the indie space, the developer has progressively taken on bigger and more ambitious projects under the leadership of SEGA.

title: Mario and Luigi: Brothership Players Aren't Happy About Luigi Change

title: Mass Effect TV Series in Development at Amazon
excerpt: A Mass Effect TV series is now officially in development at Amazon MGM Studios, featuring a seasoned team of producers from games and adaptation.
author: J Brodie Shirey
body:
Mass Effect is the latest franchise to make the jump from game to screen, as a TV series is now officially in development at Amazon. Ever since the first Mass Effect was released in 2007, BioWare’s epic sci-fi RPG series has captivated fans with a rich futuristic setting, memorable characters, and a gripping storyline that the player can shape through in-game choices that carry over from entry to entry. This storyline is centered around Commander Shepard, a human Spectre tasked with building a team of allies to save the Milky Way Galaxy from the invading Reaper armada.

title: Shigeru Miyamoto Responds to Being Called a 'Genius'

body:
Many gamers would consider Nintendo creative mastermind Shigeru Miyamoto to be a genius, but he himself recently played off such a claim, instead looking at his accomplishments with more humility. Miyamoto’s impact on not only Nintendo, but the video game industry at large is substantial, having helped create iconic franchises like Super Mario Bros, Donkey Kong, and . These franchises have gone down in history as some of the most well-known and financially successful of all time, making Nintendo a household name in the process.

title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard Reveals Scrapped Companions
excerpt: Dragon Age: The Veilguard's art book reveals some possible companions that ultimately never made it off the cutting room floor.
author: Joshua Duckworth
body:
Dragon Age has always been known for its companions, but sometimes these characters do not make it past the concept stage or off the cutting room floor. title: Grand Theft Auto 5 Dev Finally Explains the Famous Mount Chiliad Mystery
excerpt: A former Rockstar developer finally explains the eleven-year-old Mount Chiliad mystery in Grand Theft Auto 5, but it's not the answer fans wanted.
author: Kyle Knight
body:
Former Rockstar Games and Grand Theft Auto 5 developer Ben Hinchliffe has shut down the game's famous Mount Chiliad mystery, revealing that the easter egg was "just to mess with people." For well over a decade now, Grand Theft Auto 5's Mount Chiliad has been the center of a huge conspiracy theory, quickly becoming one of the biggest easter eggs in gaming history. While fans have dedicated years to cracking the easter egg, it looks like it was all for nothing.

title: Treyarch Fixes Annoying Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Issue
excerpt: Treyarch announces an update fixing an issue in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 that fans of the popular shooter found frustrating.
author: Aaron McKinley
body:
Treyarch has announced a fix for an issue in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 that limited some players' double XP gains during the game's first 2XP weekend. The latest entry in the Call of Duty franchise hadn't even been out for a week before an event offered twice the amount of experience in its multiplayer mode, but unlucky users quickly found the event wasn't working as intended. After issuing an update to address it, 's developers have extended the double XP weekend to give players more time to capitalize on it.

title: Twitch Adds Warning Label for Streams About Politics and Social Issues

author: Michael Brandon Ingram
body:
Twitch is making a major change to its policies regarding streams discussing political or social issues, now requiring streamers to add a special label to more politically-charged broadcasts. The Amazon-owned streaming platform has opened itself up to a wide variety of content from its roots as a gaming-focused platform, now housing a plethora of different creators and topics. Twitch plays host to everything from "IRL" and to even hosting celebrities and sporting events. However, one genre of content has often been controversial for the platform.

title: New Disney Game Getting Worldwide Release
excerpt: A previously announced Japan and Asia-only licensed Disney game on the Nintendo Switch is getting a global worldwide release.
author: Trumann Tu
body:
Disney Music Parade: Encore, a rhythm game that was previously announced as a Japan and Asia-only release, has been rated for a worldwide release. Disney Music Parade: Encore was first announced in August, being developed by Imagineer and will release exclusively on the Nintendo Switch. It is a rhythm action game in the same vein as Groove Coaster and Osu!, with players needing to match the on-screen prompts in time with the music. The game presents itself with various stages that look like a Disney theme park attraction.

title: Yoshi-P Wants Square Enix To Re-Release Two Classic PS1 RPGs
excerpt: Final Fantasy 14 director and producer Naoki Yoshida wants Square Enix to re-release two classic PlayStation RPGs on new platforms.
author: Trumann Tu
body:
Naoki Yoshida, the director and producer behind Final Fantasy 14, voiced his desire for Square Enix to re-release the classic PlayStation RPGs Vagrant Story and Final Fantasy Tactics. Both Final Fantasy Tactics and Vagrant Story were originally released on the PS1, developed by Square Enix as part of the greater Ivalice Alliance series. Both games received a lot of critical acclaim back in the day, and are still lauded as some of the best games by Square on the console. in particular got two sequels, one on the Game Boy Advance and one on the Nintendo DS, along with a remake of the first game in 2007 on the PlayStation Portable.

title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard is Being Review Bombed

author: Dalton Cooper

title: New Survey Could Be Encouraging News for Yakuza Fans on Switch
excerpt: A new survey from Sega is encouraging news for fans of the Yakuza games who are hoping the series will continue coming to the Nintendo Switch.
author: Trumann Tu
body:
A recent survey has suggested that Sega wants to bring more Yakuza games onto the Nintendo Switch. The Like a Dragon series, formerly known as Yakuza, finally made its debut on the Nintendo Switch platform this past October with the release of Yakuza Kiwami. First released in 2016, Yakuza Kiwami is a remake of the very first game on the PS2. The release of on the Switch marks the second time the series has been released on a Nintendo platform: the previous release was the 2013 Japan-only HD collection port for the Wii U that included the first two games in the franchise, the package being titled .

title: Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket is Already a Massive Hit
excerpt: Pokemon TCG Pocket hits a huge number of downloads within days, letting players worldwide open packs and chase ultra-rare cards for their collection.
author: Marco D'Alelio
body:
Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket was released on October 30, and within three days of it being available worldwide, it has already been downloaded several millions of times. Every day, players around the globe are opening packs in search of that thrilling moment when they pull a coveted ultra-rare card to add to their collection. Pokemon TCG Pocket allows players to open a pack every 12 hours for free, but allows in-game items and purchases to open additional packs over time.
