title: November 12 is Going to Be a Big Day for Final Fantasy 14
excerpt: During the 84th Letter From the Producer Live broadcast, Square Enix confirms exciting news for Final Fantasy 14.
author: James Ratcliff
body:
KEY TAKEAWAYS
Final Fantasy 14's 7.1 update, Crossroads, launches on November 12 with new story content and raid challenges.
The update includes the first wing of the Echoes of Vana'diel raid series and an Extreme Trial.
Patch 7.1 brings Job adjustments, a Hall of the Novice tutorial, and new events, compelling both new and veteran players alike.
During episode 84 of Letter from the Producer Live, Final Fantasy 14 producer and director Naoki Yoshida said that the long-awaited 7.1 content update will launch on Tuesday, November 12. The new Final Fantasy 14 content patch will continue the main story of Dawntrail and bring varying levels of raid challenges for players to take on.
Final Fantasy 14's 7.1 update, called Crossroads, will go live over four months after the launch of the Dawntrail expansion. During the 2024 Tokyo Game Show, Yoshida hosted a Live Letter broadcast to talk about some of Patch 7.1's biggest features. In addition to the next chapter of Dawntrail's main story, the Crossroads update will bring the first wing of the Echoes of Vana'diel alliance raid series and the expansion's third Extreme Trial, titled The Minstrel's Ballad: Sphene's Burden. Patch 7.1 will also bring some Job adjustments in both PVE and PVP content, with further PVP changes coming in Patch 7.2 in 2025.
RELATED
Final Fantasy 14 Unveils New Apparel
Square Enix’s popular MMORPG Final Fantasy 14 partners with vaultroom for a new apparel collaboration, and sales begin very soon.
On the morning of November 1, Square Enix followed up on what was discussed during the Tokyo Game Show. To start the 84th Live Letter broadcast, Square Enix released the Final Fantasy 14 Patch 7.1 launch trailer. The company confirmed that the 7.1 update would go live on Tuesday, November 12. The trailer began with the song "Vana'diel March" from Final Fantasy 11 and showed various parts of the first Echoes of Vana'diel raid. Some Final Fantasy 11 characters, including Prishe and the Shadow Lord, appeared throughout the trailer. Snippets from the Dawntrail main story and the Futures Rewritten (Ultimate) raid were also shown off. Alongside the release date for Patch 7.1, Square Enix also listed the launch dates for the rest of the Patch 7.1 series. Patch 7.11 and the new Ultimate raid will arrive two weeks later, on November 26. Patch 7.15 will arrive on December 17, with the Chaotic Alliance Raid against the Cloud of Darkness coming a week later, on Christmas Eve.
When Will Final Fantasy 14 Patch 7.1 Go Live?
Your browser does not support the video tag.
Tuesday, November 12
Although various endgame activities will soon arrive in Final Fantasy 14, the Crossroads update will have some things for newer players. An intermediate level of the Hall of the Novice will teach players some mechanics like stack markers and tankbusters. A reward will be granted to those who complete the new tutorials. Yoshida clarified that specific Job adjustments will be listed in the 7.1 patch notes, which will be posted during server maintenance.
With Patch 7.1 looming, Final Fantasy 14 players looking to complete events such as the Moogle Treasure Trove will not have much time to finish. Only time will tell if the Crossroads update will be a hit with players.

title: BioWare Dev Addresses Possibility of a Dragon Age Collection
excerpt: Following the launch of Dragon Age: The Veilguard, John Epler discusses the possibility of remastering the first three games into a single collection.
author: Christine Miller
body:
KEY TAKEAWAYS
Epler discusses challenges of remastering Dragon Age games due to engine shifts and gameplay differences.
Dragon Age: The Veilguard differs in gameplay from the original series, favoring ARPG elements.
Remastering Dragon Age would involve major technical hurdles.
In a recent interview after the launch of Dragon Age: The Veilguard, John Epler discusses the possibility, as well as the potential difficulties, of giving the original Dragon Age games a remaster. While Dragon Age: Origins introduced a modern take on the CRPG genre back in 2009, the series has since evolved in a completely different direction, favoring the combat system of BioWare's other big franchise – Mass Effect. Unlike its predecessors, Dragon Age: The Veilguard embraced an ARPG identity, and many players have described its gameplay as a blend of Mass Effect 3 and God of War.
Though The Veilguard enjoys largely positive reviews from fans and critics alike, and continues to top the charts across all platforms, the first three Dragon Age games have a special place in the heart of many a player. BioWare has often been asked about the possibility of remastering Dragon Age: Origins and its sequel, or to even remake them on the Frostbite Engine.
RELATED
Baldur's Gate 3 Publishing Director Weighs in on Dragon Age: The Veilguard
Baldur's Gate 3's publishing director talks about Dragon Age: The Veilguard, revealing their thoughts on BioWare's upcoming action RPG.
1
John Epler directly addressed the topic during his interview with Rolling Stone, as well as clarified some of the difficulties that BioWare would run into if it attempted to give Dragon Age the Legendary Edition treatment. Namely, whereas the Mass Effect trilogy was made on the Unreal Engine, Dragon Age shifted from Eclipse to Frostbite after the second game. “I think I’m one of about maybe 20 people left at BioWare who’s actually used Eclipse,” Epler says. “It’s something that’s not going to be as easy as Mass Effect, but we do love the original games. Never say never, I guess that’s what it comes down to.”
BioWare Addresses the Possibility of a Dragon Age Remaster
There is another matter to consider. Unlike Mass Effect, the Dragon Age series was never quite as confident in its identity. Each subsequent sequel was a major departure from its predecessor, and though it worked well with the franchise's anthology format, it now makes the idea of creating a Dragon Age remastered collection a far more complicated affair. Not only are there technical hurdles to solve due to a lack of developers familiar with Eclipse, but porting the games over to Frostbite would likely necessitate changes to gameplay.
BioWare confirmed that Dragon Age: The Veilguard would feature no DLCs and that the team is now committed to developing the next Mass Effect game. While Epler claims that BioWare has embraced its single-player roots after the player feedback on Anthem, he does point towards games such as Final Fantasy 14 as examples of how a multiplayer title can still tell a strong story. It remains to be seen how BioWare will continue to build upon its beloved IPs, but the success of Dragon Age: The Veilguard has certainly proven that the world of Thedas is still worth investing in.

While Terraria has seen over a decade of support from its hardworking developers, the team at Re-Logic continues to add new content to its labor of love. answer: Ubisoft is reviewing its "strategic options" for the future, a statement that comes after the company's disappointing financial results. The announcement follows rumors of a potential buyout by Chinese tech giant Tencent, but the company has not confirmed any specific plans or talks with the investor.

title: Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel Releases Huge New Update with Multiple Quality-of-Life Fixes
excerpt: Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel rolls out a massive new update to the digital trading card game, introducing a wide variety of quality-of-life fixes.
author: Michael Brandon Ingram
body:
Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel has rolled out a sizable update to the game, introducing a plethora of helpful quality-of-life changes to multiple in-game features. Since the launch of the digital version of the massively popular trading card game, Konami has continued to keep the game regularly updated with a wide variety of new content. Each month typically brings one or two new Selection Packs, adding a plethora of cards to the game, as well as new limited-time events featuring unique deck-building restrictions. The newest update is putting the focus on upgrading several quality-of-life aspects of the game.

title: Todd Howard Originally Didn't Want Troy Baker for Indiana Jones and the Great Circle

author: J Brodie Shirey
body:
Troy Baker is set to headline Indiana Jones and the Great Circle, but Bethesda head Todd Howard originally wanted somebody else to play the legendary treasure hunter. Earlier this year, Bethesda Softworks and developer MachineGames finally revealed their tribute to the Indiana Jones franchise during January’s Xbox Developer Direct livestream with an action-packed trailer of Indy swinging through ruins and beating down enemies with his trusty whip. Set between the first and third movies, follows Indy as he scours the globe for a mystical secret in 1937.

title: Genshin Impact Leak Reveals Major Character from Natlan Lore
excerpt: A major lore character in Genshin Impact is finally making his appearance in Version 5.2, as a recent leak reveals his in-game model in full detail.
author: Christine Miller
body:
An extremely detailed model of Waxaklahun Ubah Kan was discovered in the latest beta build for Version 5.2 of Genshin Impact. While NPCs in Genshin Impact rarely get unique models, the colorful tribes of Natlan and its dragons have almost necessitated a change in direction. The Children of Echoes, Scions of the Canopy, and Collective of Plenty all have unique clothing styles, and each tribe features its own Saurian with exclusive exploration abilities. Though is placing an even bigger emphasis on its NPCs than ever before in Natlan, the trend arguably started in Version 4.4 and Version 4.6 with Fujin and Naphis, respectively.

title: Sony is Shutting Down Another Game Studio

body:

title: Today is the End of an Era for Harry Potter Fans
excerpt: Today is officially the end of an era for fans of Harry Potter video games.
author: Dalton Cooper
body:
October 29 is officially the end of an era for Harry Potter fans, as Harry Potter: Magic Awakened is shutting down in the Americas, Europe, and Oceania territories. Harry Potter: Magic Awakened is a collectible card game RPG developed by Zen Studio that was first released in China and Taiwan in September of 2021. Magic Awakened was the fourth game released under the Portkey Games label, though fans in other regions had to wait a bit longer to get their hands on the game.

title: US Copyright Office Denies Petition for Remote Access to Out-Of-Print Games
excerpt: In its triennial review, the US Copyright Office denies a petition to allow remote access to out-of-print games for research purposes.
author: Richard Swanson
body:
In an October 25, 2024, announcement, the US Copyright Office denied a petition filed by the Software Preservation Network that would have allowed non-commercial remote access to out-of-print video games. The ruling is part of the US Copyright Office's triennial review of proposed exemptions to the Digital Millennium Copyright Act, which defines limits for the circumvention of technology preventing unauthorized access to copyrighted works.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 players discover a classic feature from older games in the franchise that can be very easy to miss.
Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 players discover that Treyarch has added back the chicken sound effect for those opting to not prestige in multiplayer. The latest Call of Duty title has arrived and reaction to it so far has been very positive. Fans and reviewers alike have called the Black Ops 6 campaign one of the best in a long time, and with surging player numbers, it's clear this is another hit for the long-running series.

title: Nvidia Has Become the World’s Most Valuable Company
excerpt: High-end PC and console chip manufacturer Nvidia rises to the top rank as the most valuable company in the world in terms of market value.
author: J Brodie Shirey
body:
Computer and console part manufacturer Nvidia recently became the world’s most valuable company, beating out tech giant Apple in terms of market value. Nvidia is a brand many hardcore PC gamers will recognize thanks to its line of cutting-edge processor chipsets, which have been used to power high-end gaming rigs and office workspaces alike. Recently, the company celebrated the 25th anniversary of its Nvidia GeForce 256, which helped put Nvidia on the map back in 1999.

title: PlayStation Plus User Subscribes For Absurd Amount of Time
excerpt: A PlayStation Plus user is sharing their incredible subscription to the premium Sony service, securing their premium status for years to come.
author: Michael Brandon Ingram
body:
A PlayStation Plus user has shared their staggering subscription to the premium service from Sony, with their PS Plus membership set to last more than twenty years. PlayStation Plus serves as Sony's major answer to the rise of Xbox Game Pass, not only offering access to online gameplay but a wealth of games included. Sony features multiple different tiers of membership within PS Plus, from Essentials granting monthly rotating games giving players access to a library of retro games. Now, one user has set themselves up for a long membership.

title: Toby Fox Shares New Update on Deltarune Chapter 5 Progress
excerpt: Deltarune creator Toby Fox gives fans another brief but encouraging update about the game and the development status of its fifth chapter.
author: Trumann Tu
body:
Deltarune creator Toby Fox gave fans a brief update on the game's development, mentioning how he's working on Chapter 5 "every day." Deltarune is an episodic RPG whose release has been spread out over the last few years, unlike Toby Fox's previous work, Undertale. Chapter 1 was first dropped in 2018, much to the surprise of many fans following his work. The second chapter got a similar shadow drop release in 2021. Now fans are eagerly anticipating the release of 's next set of chapters, which are Chapters 3, 4, and 5, all of which are in development.

title: Sega Employees Detail How Sonic the Hedgehog Games Are Written
excerpt: Following the release of Sonic X Shadow Generations, a couple of Sega employees detail how Sonic the Hedgehog games are written.
author: Trumann Tu
body:
Following the recently released Sonic X Shadow Generations, a few Sega employees have detailed how Sonic the Hedgehog games are written now. Sonic X Shadow Generations finally launched this October, and was one of the most eagerly anticipated releases of the year. While Sonic Generations was remastered in this release, the main attraction of the game is Shadow Generations, a solo story featuring Sonic's anti-hero rival. A lot of focus is given to Shadow's character and backstory in the plot of , as he awakens to a variety of new Doom Powers and faces his painful past.

body:
The Pokemon Let's Go games are hosting a brand-new distribution event giving fans a chance to pick up the elusive Meltan, but only in one region of the world. The pair of games featuring a return to the Kanto region served as the first major Pokemon releases on the Nintendo Switch and packed in plenty of departures from past games. body:
Disney's Cars may be coming to Fortnite sometime soon, according to a leak. As Fortnite expands into an experience-based service that houses more than a single game, though, these collaborations may end up extending to parts of the title that could use the extra attention, ensuring that when players get tired of one mode, they can just try out another part of the game and find a similar level of depth.

title: McDonald's Japan Has a New Mascot
excerpt: McDonald's in Japan rolls out a new anime-style mascot to sell double cheeseburgers, while also reintroducing a more familiar face.
author: Matthew Schomer
body:
McDonald's restaurants in Japan have a new mascot promoting limited-time fast food items, and she's vastly different than the red-and-yellow-dressed clown that the company is best known for. The new mascot, named Imadakedabuchitabemi, is drawn and animated in anime art style, and she derives part of her name from dabuchi, the name for double cheeseburger items currently being sold at Japanese McDonald's locations.

Pokemon GO players share complaints about the difficulty of Max Raids, which let parties catch Dynamax and Gigantamax Pokemon.
Pokemon GO players have been complaining about the extreme difficulty of the game's Max Raids, especially when they can't get a full party of 39 other players to join in. Max Raids in Pokemon GO make it possible to add massive Dynamax and Gigantamax Pokemon to players' rosters, but actually defeating and capturing them seems like an insurmountable task for many.

answer: Pokémon GO players are expressing frustration with the difficulty of Max Raids, specifically when attempting to catch Dynamax and Gigantamax Pokémon without a full 39-player party. The raids have become a significant challenge for many players, making it hard to add these powerful Pokémon to their rosters.

title: Sonic X Shadow Generations is Already a Massive Hit
excerpt: Sega's Sonic X Shadow Generations is already seeing huge success, crossing a massive franchise milestone on the day of its launch.
author: Trumann Tu
body:
Sonic X Shadow Generations just launched but is already a huge hit, with the game managing to sell a million units on release day. The success of Sonic X Shadow Generations isn't too surprising for Sonic fans, as it has been one of the most eagerly anticipated of 2024. While the game includes a remaster of 2011's Sonic Generations, the main draw for many is Shadow the Hedgehog's solo campaign. Not only is Sonic's anti-hero rival put into the spotlight since his last playable appearance in 2017's , but the character's story and unique powers are the main reason why so many fans have been excited about this updated re-release.

body:

Beyond Good and Evil 2 is a bit infamous for being in development hell. It was first teased at E3 2008 with a brief reveal trailer, but it wouldn't get a follow-up until it made a surprise appearance at E3 2017 and E3 2018. The game seemingly went dark again after that, as still hasn't seen the light of day, over 15 years since it was first revealed.

Ubisoft has said that the long-awaited Beyond Good and Evil 2 is still in development, saying that it recently passed an internal milestone with positive feedback. Beyond Good and Evil 2 is a bit infamous for being in development hell. It was first teased at E3 2008 with a brief reveal trailer, but it wouldn't get a follow-up until it made a surprise appearance at E3 2017 and E3 2018. The game seemingly went dark again after that, as still hasn't seen the light of day, over 15 years since it was first revealed.

title: Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree Player Completes Grueling 1 HP Run
excerpt: Months after its release, one dedicated Elden Ring player manages to complete the game's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC with a single HP.
author: Luke Dammann
body:
A dedicated Elden Ring player managed to do the impossible: complete the game's Shadow of the Erdtree expansion with only 1 HP, 1 FP, and 1 Stamina. The painful task took streamer Ainrun dozens upon dozens of hours, as Shadow of the Erdtree features some of FromSoftware's most brutal boss fights ever. title: LEGO Horizon Adventures Goes Gold

body:
LEGO Horizon Adventures has officially gone Gold, meaning that the game is ready to launch on November 14. During June’s Summer Game Fest 2024 livestream, Horizon fans were greeted by a surprising trailer featuring LEGO versions of Aloy and her friends battling with plastic machines. LEGO Horizon Adventures is naturally being released for PlayStation 5 and PC, but gamers were surprised to learn that the title is also headed to the Nintendo Switch, making it the first title to be available on Nintendo hardware.

Google announces a new agreement with a Californian engineering company to procure energy from next-generation nuclear reactors.
Google has announced a new agreement to purchase electricity from small modular reactors (SMRs), an emerging next-generation nuclear technology. This deal marks the first corporate agreement of its kind and signals a new frontier in clean energy to power Google's AI ventures, with the reactors expected to go live by 2030.

body:

title: Call of Duty Looking to Ban Cheaters Within 1 Hour of Their First Match
excerpt: Activision claims it will use new technology to detect and remove cheaters incredibly quickly from Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 matches.
author: Luke Dammann
body:
Ahead of the launch of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6, publisher Activision has shared it will be using artificial intelligence to detect and remove cheaters from the game within an hour of them loading up their first match. Cheaters have long been an issue for Call of Duty and the FPS genre as a whole, with Activision deploying several systems and features in an attempt to minimize exposure to those not playing by the rules. title: Gamer Builds Incredible Xbox Handheld
excerpt: A talented and tech-savvy gamer builds an impressive Xbox handheld capable of playing any game from the original Xbox console's library.
author: J Brodie Shirey
body:
A talented gamer has put together a working Xbox handheld console that can play over a thousand titles without emulation. The original Xbox launched on November 15, 2001, and quickly cemented Microsoft as a third gaming console company alongside PlayStation and Nintendo. In the two decades since, Microsoft has evolved its Xbox brand with the Xbox 360, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X/S consoles, but has largely stayed away from the handheld gaming field that its competitors have ventured into with varying success. To date, the closest thing Xbox has to a portable system is streaming Game Pass Ultimate titles on mobile devices through Xbox Cloud Gaming.

title: Silent Hill 2 Dev Has Harsh Way to Describe Studio's Older Games
excerpt: A producer at Bloober Team refers to the studio's past games in an unforgiving way in the wake of Silent Hill 2's huge success.
author: John Bonelli
body:
A producer at Bloober Team, the studio responsible for the recent remake of Silent Hill 2, indicates that he doesn't look back on the studio's past work too fondly. The Silent Hill 2 remake was released in early October to glowing reviews, surprising many gamers who felt the game looked subpar in its showings leading up to release. The remake of Konami's 2001 horror classic has become the best-reviewed game in the fifteen-year history of , sitting at an average score of 87 on OpenCritic.

title: Call of Duty Gets Gigantic New Update

body:
Call of Duty players are able to download a big new update that preloads Black Ops 6 and improves Call of Duty HQ's problematic UI. Bringing the return of round-based Zombies, a single-player campaign set in the early 90s, and 16 original multiplayer maps, Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is one of the biggest releases of the Fall season and has fans eager to check out its enticing new omnimovement system that lets players sprint, slide, and dive in any direction.

title: Switch Version of Game With 'Very Positive' Reviews Delayed Indefinitely

author: Trumann Tu
body:

Valley Peaks was first announced as part of Nintendo's April 2024 Indie World Showcase, and it was expected to come to both PC via Steam and the Nintendo Switch platform. title: Subnautica 2 Is Implementing a Feature Cut From The Original Game
excerpt: The original Subnautica was packed with cut content, with one of the biggest examples set to return in the sequel as a significant mechanic.
author: Jack Webster
body:
Fans looking forward to Subnautica 2 have finally gotten a better look at what to expect from the sequel after the release of its first official teaser trailer, with new information suggesting that the game will be featuring a major scrapped gameplay mechanic that never made it into the original Subnautica. While the game doesn't have an official release date just yet, is set to be available in early access at an unspecified date early in 2025, and is due to be available on Xbox Game Pass from day one.

title: Genshin Impact Leak Teases Important NPCs in Version 5.2
excerpt: A recent Genshin Impact leak is teasing a pair of important NPCs coming to the Natlan region with the launch of the Version 5.2 update.
author: Michael Brandon Ingram
body:
A new leak from Genshin Impact is showing off a pair of important NPCs set to come to the game during Version 5.2, showcasing two new Natlan tribal chiefs. The addition of the HoYoverse RPG's sixth playable region in Natlan saw the game break plenty of traditions from its past regional launches. HoYoverse introduced the game's first mounts with Natlan's Saurian creatures, as well as Natlan becoming the first region to . Now, one of the region's biggest changes is getting another update in the near future.
